tool.name: IDRTCalibration
tool.description: Can be used to calibrate RTs of peptide hits linearly to standards.
tool.command:
@QUOTE_FOO@ @EXT_FOO@ #import re
## Preprocessing mkdir in && ln -s '$in' 'in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in.ext)' && mkdir out &&
## Main program call
set -o pipefail && @EXECUTABLE@ -write_ctd ./ && python3 '$__tool_directory__/fill_ctd.py' '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$args_json' '$hardcoded_json' && @EXECUTABLE@ -ini @EXECUTABLE@.ctd -in 'in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in.ext)' -out 'out/output.${gxy2omsext("idxml")}'
## Postprocessing && mv 'out/output.${gxy2omsext("idxml")}' '$out' #if "ctd_out_FLAG" in $OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS && mv '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$ctd_out' #end if

param.label: The RT of the first calibrant in the reference file
The RT of the second calibrant in the reference file
The RT of the first calibrant in the input file
param.help: Please note that this value needs to be set. The default value -1.0 is not allowed

param.label: The RT of the second calibrant in the input file
param.help: Please note that this value needs to be set. The default value -1.0 is not allowed

param.label: Enables the test mode (needed for internal use only)

data.name: ctd_out
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: ctd
data.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "ctd_out_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

tool.help:
Can be used to calibrate RTs of peptide hits linearly to standards.
For more information, visit http://www.openms.de/doxygen/release/2.8.0/html/TOPP_IDRTCalibration.html
